alert.note: Alert for Bosque (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 1:36PM CDT until October 29 at 11:43AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... North Bosque River Near Clifton affecting Bosque County. North Bosque River At Valley Mills affecting Bosque and McLennan Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Bosque River near Clifton. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 31.0 feet, Major flooding is expected. Water will be approaching the former Clifton Armory and the American Legion Hall near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 31.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 32.3 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
